result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Makayla Diana Taylor not in court.  
Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Makayla Diana Taylor.  
Attorney Erika Strebel in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case calendared for a Scheduling Conference. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. 
Defense has no explanation for defendants non appearance and  request a calendar call date.  
Court ordered bench warrant issued, Remand to the Judge and STAYED issuance until the next court date.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. This hearing will be in person.
Calendar call scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE ADJOURNED OFF THE RECORD:  Case calendared for a Status Conference.  Court ordered case adourned.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Makayla Diana Taylor in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Makayla Diana Taylor in custody.  William R. F. Ackell for Alexandria Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for return on doctors report. Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.  State, defense counsel and defendant are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report.
Court  adopts the professional opinion of the examiner's that the defendant does not lack substantial capacity to understand the proceedings or aid in his/her defense. 
Court finds defendant competent and reinstates the proceedings.  Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Makayla Diana Taylor in court by zoom with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.
Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for Doctor's report return, however the defendant missed the appointment for the forensic exam due to health issues.  The exam has been rescheduled to July 25, 2022 at 9:30.  Court orders parties to appear in-person.

Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Competency Evaluation No Show Letter
Order signed and forwarded to forensic Unit

Defendant Makayla Diana Taylor in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Case adjourned for Return on Dr. Report in Br 45.  mn  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Makayla Diana Taylor in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Discovery and Offer has been received by the Defense.  Defense is requesting an adjourned date for status to review materials with client.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Makayla Diana Taylor in court with Grace Hagerman under the student practice rule,for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The parties appeared via zoom.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Marco Lopez   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case adjourned to Br. 45.
all conditions of bail remain as previously set.

Defendant Makayla Diana Taylor in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Bench warrant was issued 2/21/2022. Defendant is now present with counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant having failed to appeare, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
received and filed.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Patrick D C, Madelena T, and The Alliance School, 850 West Walnut Street, Milwaukee, WI

Defendant Makayla Diana Taylor in court with attorney Nicholas M Weege.  Defendant Makayla Diana Taylor in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Makayla Diana Taylor appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 3.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
